channel.title: The MoparScape Million Dollar Question
channel.description: I'm just sort of curious. I'm not trying to act like some bad-ass, and I will say right now I do not know one bit of Java. But its a question that makes you think. Lets take RSPS as an example. When it comes to RuneScape Private Servers, how many people actually know what they are doing? And how many people are following a tutorial? [b]Discuss & Vote. This poll will be open for 2 weeks.[/b]

item.title: The MoparScape Million Dollar Question
item.dc:creator: @CookieScape CookieScape
item.description:
@CookieScape wrote:

I’d say the second one. Closer to the first, but second one I’d choose.

Read full topic

item.title: The MoparScape Million Dollar Question
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I’d say I’d fall in between the middle. I learned the structure of the JAVA programming language through RuneScape Servers (which is probably a bad thing) and expanded through javadocs. The only thing that bugs me is the circulation of horrible sources.

As far as options go, I tend to look at tutorials for ideas, rather than help. It allows me to expand my own ideas on top of other people’s to make something unique in its own way, but not “crazy” unique.

I still have a lot more to learn but I’m only 16 and I started around 7 months ago. So I do have a fair bit of knowledge.

Read full topic

item.title: The MoparScape Million Dollar Question
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:20, topic:344037”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=440417.msg3236621#msg3236621 date=1276535183]

I don’t know how to program RSPS, but thats because I never really wanted to, I like GFX’s more so I joined these forums mainly for the model section, BUT! I have started on a server lol and without any tutorials I have added in a level 100+ zone :D(all by my self xD, yes I feel special) So I don’t know which I fall under.

Well if you did something like that all by yourself, I’m sure that would fall somewhere in the middle. That means your starting to understand the language, you no longer need training wheels (the tutorials).

Oh cool, I guess thats not bad for my 4th day working on it.

if (ObjectID == objectid) { if (combatLevel >= 100) { toX = x coords; toY = y coords; } } else { sM("You need 100 or higher combat to access this area."); }
[/quote]Your code is fine, though I would just use && instead[/quote]I know i just cba quickly did it teh nub way to make it look harder to him lol; even forgot conventions -.-

Read full topic

item.title: The MoparScape Million Dollar Question
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:8, topic:344037”]Hey, even the best programmers who are professionals need external resources to work with any code. They can’t magically absorb all of the classes,methods and fields if they have never seen that particular code before. This is why javadocs exist.
Your poll is flawed.

ps, whoever voted I can write anything with my own knowledge is a faggot.[/quote]
I was actually the first person to select that option. I presumed that it meant that no assistance is required from other users of this website.
I also took the bit about programming from scratch to be related to servers; I’m capable of writing a server application from the ground up, rather than downloading XYZScape and expanding on it.

Read full topic
